sentences.english: During the busy harvest season, farmers get up at the crack of dawn and don't stop working until dusk.
sentences.chinese: 在农忙季节，农夫从破晓就开始起床工作直到黄昏。

sentences.english: At this moment, to announce the end of busy periods.
sentences.chinese: 这一刻，宣告着农忙时期的结束。

sentences.english: During busy seasons they help with field work.
sentences.chinese: 农忙季节他们帮助干农活。

sentences.english: Our business in the city is not good when it's busy seasons for farmers.
sentences.chinese: 农忙时进城的人不多生意比较清淡。

sentences.english: In the busy season the village looked deserted when all the peasants had gone to the fields.
sentences.chinese: 农忙季节，人都下地了，村子里显得空荡荡的。

sentences.english: Self-employed farmers work from 55 to 60 hours per week during the peak summer mouths.
sentences.chinese: 自耕农在夏天农忙季节每星期劳动55到60小时。

sentences.english: I may be able to get off after the busy farming season.
sentences.chinese: 农忙季节过后我也许能离开。

sentences.english: He had even been kept out of school during the busiest seasons.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至于在农忙的时候被阻止去上学。

sentences.english: They made a living in Shanghai during the slack seasons of farming and returned during the busy ones.
sentences.chinese: 他们多在农闲期奔赴上海谋生，又在农忙时返乡务农。

definition: to plow a field in the spring
to thresh or husk grain on a threshing ground (dialect)
